comments.author: mich
comments.body: I believe that most men in life seek power because having power gives you control and influence. And this can be applied to just about everything that a man does, from his personal life to work. Take for example a person that just got hired at a warehouse for an entry-level position, he wonâ€™t have that much power or authority over other coworkers or employees. As opposed to a supervisor or manager that knows the operation of the job along with other necessary skills. In this position not only do you have a certain amount of control but as well as the power to either hire or fire a worker. This also means that by having control and power you shouldnâ€™t be diminishing other peopleâ€™s egos, instead be an example by being a great leader with a humble attitude. People or coworkers will recognize you for being a great guy with them and not letting power get to your head.

comments.author: AI Am I
comments.body: Quote from: OGsmall on March 14, 2023, 12:26:21 PMFor me, not all men want the same thing of course, But fromÂ  where I come from most men want thing like Power over all, Wealth for some is more important to them to and also the key word called "Respect" and also they want to be called the bread-winner of the house, And like to be treated in a way that does'nt Diminish their Egos or make them feel inadequate and also a man want this most in his life to always praised him for his hard works and above all they to be called a Great Guy. It is important to remember that not all men have the same desires or goals in life, and that societal and cultural factors can also influence what men may prioritize in their lives. That being said, some men may value power, wealth, and respect, as well as being seen as the primary provider for their family. Others may prioritize personal growth, relationships, or creative pursuits. Ultimately, what each man wants most in life will depend on his individual values, experiences, and goals. It is important to approach each person as an individual with unique desires and priorities, rather than making assumptions based on gender.

comments.author: james_smith77
comments.body: Love and companionship: Like all humans, men seek love and companionship from their family, friends, and romantic partners.Success and achievement: Many men strive for success and achievement in their careers, hobbies, and personal goals.Financial security: Men may also desire financial security and stability to support themselves and their families.Health and wellness: Maintaining good physical and mental health is important to many men as it allows them to enjoy life and pursue their interests.Adventure and excitement: Some men may desire adventure and excitement in their lives, seeking out new experiences and challenges.
